@@info: Here are translations that exist in <en> but not in secondary locales.
After editing this file, you can run 'flutter pub run slang apply --locale=<locale>' to quickly apply the newly added translations.

faq.q: هل سأفقد ملاحظاتي إذا قمت بتسجيل الخروج؟
faq.a: لا. ستظل ملاحظاتك على كل من جهازك وعلى الخادم. لن تتم مزامنتها مع الخادم حتى تقوم بتسجيل الدخول مرة أخرى. تأكد من اكتمال المزامنة قبل تسجيل الخروج حتى لا تفقد أي بيانات (انظر تقدم المزامنة على الشاشة الرئيسية).

faq.q: كيف يمكنني تغيير كلمة المرور الخاصة بي على Nextcloud؟
faq.a: انتقل إلى موقع الخادم الخاص بك وقم بتسجيل الدخول. ثم انتقل إلى الإعدادات > الأمان > تغيير كلمة المرور. ستحتاج إلى تسجيل الخروج وتسجيل الدخول مرة أخرى إلى Sabre بعد تغيير كلمة المرور الخاصة بك.

faq.q: كيف يمكنني تغيير كلمة مرور التشفير الخاصة بي؟
faq.a:
1. تسجيل الخروج من Sabre. تأكد من اكتمال المزامنة قبل تسجيل الخروج حتى لا تفقد أي بيانات (انظر تقدم المزامنة على الشاشة الرئيسية).

2. اذهب إلى موقع الخادم الخاص بك واحذف مجلد

الخاص بك. سيؤدي هذا إلى حذف كافة ملاحظاتك من الخادم.

3. قم بتسجيل الدخول مرة أخرى إلى Sabre. يمكنك اختيار كلمة مرور تشفير جديدة عند تسجيل الدخول.

4. لا تنس تسجيل الخروج وتسجيل الدخول مرة أخرى إلى Sabre على أجهزتك الأخرى أيضًا.

faq.q: كيف يمكنني حذف حسابي؟
faq.a:
انتقل إلى موقع الخادم الخاص بك وقم بتسجيل الدخول. ثم انتقل إلى الإعدادات> حذف الحساب.

إذا كنت تستخدم خادم Sabre الرسمي، فسيتم حذف حسابك بعد فترة سماح مدتها أسبوع. يمكنك الاتصال بي على adilhanney@disroot.org خلال هذه الفترة لإلغاء الحذف.

إذا كنت تستخدم خادم جهة خارجية، فقد لا يكون هناك خيار لحذف حسابك: ستحتاج إلى استشارة خصوصية الخادم سياسة لمزيد من المعلومات.

faq.q: Will I lose my notes if I log out?
faq.a: No. Your notes will remain both on your device and on the server. They won't be synced with the server until you log back in. Make sure syncing is complete before logging out so you don't lose any data (see the sync progress on the home screen).

faq.q: How do I change my Nextcloud password?
faq.a: Go to your server website and log in. Then go to Settings > Security > Change password. You'll need to log out and log back in to Saber after changing your password.

faq.q: How do I change my encryption password?
faq.a:
1. Log out of Saber. Make sure syncing is complete before logging out so you don't lose any data (see the sync progress on the home screen).

2. Go to your server website and delete your 'Saber' folder. This will delete all your notes from the server.

3. Log back in to Saber. You can choose a new encryption password when logging in.

4. Don't forget to log out and log back in to Saber on your other devices too.

faq.q: How can I delete my account?
faq.a:
Go to your server website and log in. Then go to Settings > Delete account.

If you are using the official Saber server, your account will be deleted after a 1 week grace period. You can contact me at adilhanney@disroot.org during this period to cancel the deletion.

If you are using a third party server, there might not be an option to delete your account: you'll need to consult the server's privacy policy for more information.

faq.q: How can I delete my account?
faq.a:
Go to your server website and log in. Then go to Settings > Delete account.

faq(OUTDATED).a: Nextcloud is a private file sync server, among other things. You can use the default Saber Nextcloud server, use a third-party server, or self-host your own for full control of your data.

The encryption password is used to encrypt your data before it is sent to the server. You choose it when you first login to Saber, and it's not related to your Nextcloud account/password.

No-one can access your notes on the server without your encryption password. This also means that if you forget your encryption password, you will lose access to your data.

The Nextcloud password is used to access the cloud. The encryption password "scrambles" your data before it ever reaches the cloud.

Even if someone gains access to your Nextcloud account, your notes will remain safe and encrypted with a separate password. This provides you a second layer of security to protect your data.

faq(OUTDATED).q: How do I login if I use 2FA?
faq(OUTDATED).a: Instead of your regular Nextcloud password, you'll need to create an "app password". You can do this in your Nextcloud settings under Security > Devices & sessions > Create new app password. Your encryption password is unaffected.

faq(OUTDATED).q: Can I use the same password for both?
faq(OUTDATED).a: Yes, but doing so is less secure. Since your Nextcloud password is sent to the server, someone with access to the server would be able to decrypt your notes. Only use the same password if you trust the server owner.

faq.q: Will I lose my notes if I log out?
faq.a: No. Your notes will remain both on your device and on the server. They won't be synced with the server until you log back in. Make sure syncing is complete before logging out so you don't lose any data (see the sync progress on the home screen).

faq.a: Go to your server website and log in. Then go to Settings > Security > Change password. You'll need to log out and log back in to Saber after changing your password.

faq.a:
1. Log out of Saber. Make sure syncing is complete before logging out so you don't lose any data (see the sync progress on the home screen).

2. Go to your server website and delete your 'Saber' folder. This will delete all your notes from the server.

3. Log back in to Saber. You can choose a new encryption password when logging in.

4. Don't forget to log out and log back in to Saber on your other devices too.

faq.q: How can I delete my account?

Go to your server website and log in. Then go to Settings > Delete account.

If you are using the official Saber server, your account will be deleted after a 1 week grace period. You can contact me at adilhanney@disroot.org during this period to cancel the deletion.

If you are using a third party server, there might not be an option to delete your account: you'll need to consult the server's privacy policy for more information.
